title: Roasted Tomato Pasta
intro: My spin on a recipe inspired by Kenji Lopez-Alt's quick fresh tomato pasta. Roasting the tomatoes in the over adds additional with less mess.

description.name: 3-4 Cloves of garlic end trimmed and peel on

context.note: The peel prevents the garlic from burning
Fish sauce pairs well with tomato-based sauces

instructions.step: Wash and cut **cherry tomatoes** in half. Toss tomatoes in bowl with **olive oil**, salt, and pepper. Place tomatoes and **garlic** on a parchment-lined baking sheet flesh side up and in a single layer if possible. Roast 450F for 25-30 minutes

context.note: Parchment paper is non-stick. Putting tomatoes flesh side up prevents the tomato skins from burning. Single layer prevents crowding

instructions.step: Season **raw shrimp** with **salt** and a pinch of **baking soda**
instructions.background: Tomatoes and garlic are in the oven

context.note: Small amount of baking soda prevents the shrimp from becoming mushy

instructions.background: Tomatoes and garlic are in the oven

instructions.step: Boil **pasta** in **salted** **water** for 1-2 minutes before instructions for al dente. Set aside pasta and pasta cooking water.
instructions.background: Tomatoes and garlic are in the oven

context.note: Pasta will finish cooking in during the next step

instructions.step: Fry **marinated shrimp** in a pan in high heat for less than 1 minute until slightly brown. Remove from heat.

- Remove peel from garlic. Pour roasted tomato and garlic into pan. Add **basil** to sauce mixture. Add **cooked pasta** to pan and stir fry on high heat.
  - Remove pan from heat and add **grated cheese**.
  - Return to heat and add **black pepper** and olive oil and cook for another 30 seconds.
  - Add **salt** to taste. Add more **pasta water** to adjust consistency.
Add **cooked shrimp** to pasta and toss to combine
